messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Not-Back-To-School
messages.msgSnippet: ... The Victoria Homelearners have been doing this for a number of years now.  (We stole the idea from Vancouver.)  We meet at a wonderful local beach around
messages.messageBody:
>
>I'm planning a Not-Back-To-School Party for the day the schoolkids go back
>here. I've gotten a few jittery emails lately from local newbie
>homeschoolers with 5 and 6 year olds. Hopefully this wil help them all
>connect and for the kids to see they're not the only ones staying home from
>the school scene. It will not be starting at 7:00 a.m. ;-)

The Victoria Homelearners have been doing this for a number of years
now. (We stole the idea from Vancouver.) We meet at a wonderful local
beach around late morning of the first day of school. Not only is it a
great chance to re-connect with home learners we haven't seen for a while,
it's also great for newbies. They get a chance to see a lot of kids and
parents who seem pretty normal. They get to see a lot of kids of all ages
mostly getting along well. Even though my teen doesn't like going anymore,
*I* still go. <g>
Tia

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt
*********************************************
Tia Leschke
leschke@...
On Vancouver Island

messages.subject: Not-Back-To-School
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m planning a Not-Back-To-School Party for the day the schoolkids go back here. I ve gotten a few jittery emails lately from local newbie homeschoolers
messages.messageBody:
>>Public school started here yesterday. I hugged my six year old until she
>>asked me what was going on and I told her I was so glad she was here and
>>not gone on a school bus at 7 a.m.>>

I'm planning a Not-Back-To-School Party for the day the schoolkids go back
here. I've gotten a few jittery emails lately from local newbie
homeschoolers with 5 and 6 year olds. Hopefully this wil help them all
connect and for the kids to see they're not the only ones staying home from
the school scene. It will not be starting at 7:00 a.m. ;-)

Life is good.
~Mary
